verses.text: \add It is a\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \add thing\add* to give \w thanks|strong="H3034"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and to sing \w praises|strong="H2167"\w* unto thy \w name|strong="H8034"\w*, O most \w High|strong="H5945"\w*:

To shew \w forth|strong="H5046"\w* thy \w lovingkindness|strong="H2617"\w* in the \w morning|strong="H1242"\w*, and thy \w faithfulness|strong="H0530"\w* every \w night|strong="H3915"\w*,\f + \fr 92.2 \ft every…: Heb. in the nights\f*

Upon an instrument of ten \w strings|strong="H6218"\w*, and upon the \w psaltery|strong="H5035"\w*; upon the \w harp|strong="H3658"\w* with a solemn \w sound|strong="H1902"\w*.\f + \fr 92.3 \ft the harp…: or, the solemn sound with the harp\f*\f + \fr 92.3 \ft a solemn…: Heb. Higgaion\f*

For thou, \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, hast made me \w glad|strong="H8055"\w* through thy \w work|strong="H6467"\w*: I will \w triumph|strong="H7442"\w* in the \w works|strong="H4639"\w* of thy \w hands|strong="H3027"\w*.

O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, how \w great|strong="H1431"\w* are thy \w works|strong="H4639"\w*! \add and\add* thy \w thoughts|strong="H4284"\w* are \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w deep|strong="H6009"\w*.
A \w brutish|strong="H1198"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* not; neither doth a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* \w understand|strong="H0995"\w* this.

When the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \w spring|strong="H6524"\w* as the \w grass|strong="H6212"\w*, and when all the \w workers|strong="H6466"\w* of \w iniquity|strong="H0205"\w* do \w flourish|strong="H6692"\w*; \add it is\add* that they shall be \w destroyed|strong="H8045"\w* for \w ever|strong="H5703"\w*:
But thou, \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add art most\add* \w high|strong="H4791"\w* for \w evermore|strong="H5769"\w*.

For, lo, thine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, for, lo, thine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w* shall \w perish|strong="H0006"\w*; all the \w workers|strong="H6466"\w* of \w iniquity|strong="H0205"\w* shall be \w scattered|strong="H6504"\w*.

But my \w horn|strong="H7161"\w* shalt thou \w exalt|strong="H7311"\w* like \add the horn of\add* an \w unicorn|strong="H7214"\w*: I shall be \w anointed|strong="H1101"\w* with \w fresh|strong="H7488"\w* \w oil|strong="H8081"\w*.

Mine \w eye|strong="H5869"\w* also shall \w see|strong="H5027"\w* \add my desire\add* on mine \w enemies|strong="H7790"\w*, \add and\add* mine \w ears|strong="H0241"\w* shall \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* \add my desire\add* of the \w wicked|strong="H7489"\w* that rise \w up|strong="H6965"\w* against me.

The \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* shall \w flourish|strong="H6524"\w* like the palm \w tree|strong="H8558"\w*: he shall \w grow|strong="H7685"\w* like a \w cedar|strong="H0730"\w* in \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w*.

Those that be \w planted|strong="H8362"\w* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall \w flourish|strong="H6524"\w* in the \w courts|strong="H2691"\w* of our \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

They shall still bring forth \w fruit|strong="H5107"\w* in old \w age|strong="H7872"\w*; they shall be \w fat|strong="H1879"\w* and \w flourishing|strong="H7488"\w*;\f + \fr 92.14 \ft flourishing: Heb. green\f*

To \w shew|strong="H5046"\w* that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* \w upright|strong="H3477"\w*: \add he is\add* my \w rock|strong="H6697"\w*, and \add there is\add* no \w unrighteousness|strong="H5766"\w* in him.
